com.jmex.physics
Class StaticPhysicsObject

java.lang.Object
  com.jmex.physics.PhysicsObject
      com.jmex.physics.StaticPhysicsObject

public class StaticPhysicsObject
extends PhysicsObject

A StaticPhysicsObject does not contain any dynamical properties, e.g. mass or velocity. It can be considered as a blockage to other physics objects. It does not respond to any forces. Hence, it's static in the world. Good for such a thing as terrain.

Author:
Ahmed Al-Hindawi, Per Thulin
See Also:
PhysicsWorld, DynamicPhysicsObject

Constructor Detail

StaticPhysicsObject

public StaticPhysicsObject(com.jme.scene.Geometry graphics)
Constructor for the StaticPhysicsObject. It will create the object and store it. To add it to the current simulation, you call PhysicsWorld.addObject(PhysicsObject) after creation

Parameters:
graphics - The graphical representation.
Method Detail

syncWithGraphical

public void syncWithGraphical()
This method should be called after having manually changed the rotation/translation of the jME Geometry.

isStatic

public boolean isStatic()
Returns whether or not this object is static. In this case, it will always return static
